home.h2: In the Master of Computer Engineering
home.h4: Development of an experimental tool to create biomedical consultations through text mining
home.p1: This application evaluates the quality of a series of queries that are generated from the method of selecting terms. We have three types of files:
home.p2: A user's workspace can include as many sets of documents as desired. Each set contains one positive and one negative file.
home.p3: The positive is included first. Once the files are uploaded to the server they will be indexed.
home.p4: For the application to index the files have to be written in plain text (.txt), the title, abstract and keywords of each document will be saved, they have to have the following format:
home.p4.2: The line of the abstract begins with 'AB -'.
home.p5: If one of the parts of the document we have named exists, it will be indexed.
home.p6: To evaluate a set of documents (SDS or FVS), we will have to select a couple of TIS files, decide how many terms will form our query and choose one of the filters.
home.p7: Once the query has been formed we can evaluate the set of documents we have selected. It is possible to include the Boolean operator AND in the query, in which case all the terms must be in the same document.
home.p8: If any performance measure cannot be calculated, the application will return the value 0.
home.p9: Independently, text searches can be made on pairs of FVS and FDS files.
